summary: Big Ben is one of the top places to visit in the United Kingdom, located near Westminster Abbey in central London. This iconic clock tower, designed by Augustus Pugin, stands about a hundred meters tall. It has been designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site and attracts numerous tourists annually who often pose for photos in front of it.

summary: The London Eye is a giant Ferris wheel located on the river Thames in Lambeth, London. It serves as both an observation deck and a unique attraction in the UK.

summary: Stonehenge is a Neolithic site located near Amesbury, England, dating back to 3000 BC. This UNESCO World Heritage Site remains a mystery, with its purpose speculated to be either a burial ground or an astronomical observatory. Surrounded by other Neolithic sites, it is a significant historical and cultural landmark in the United Kingdom.
